intro: Chondroscaphe embreei, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and is typically found growing on rocky outcrops or in dry, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow, which bloom during the cooler months. It has thick, waxy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Chondroscaphe embreei is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low precipitation, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
